case_vignette: A 51-YEAR-OLD WHITE MAN PRESENTS TO THE CLINIC WITH A 2-YEAR HISTORY OF A PAINFUL, RECURRENT RASH ON HIS FINGERS. HE INITIALLY NOTICED REDNESS, IRRITATION, AND PUSTULES AROUND HIS NAILS THAT HE THOUGHT WERE CAUSED BY AN INFECTION. HOWEVER, THE RASH PROGRESSED TO AFFECT THE NAIL BED, EVENTUALLY DESTROYING HIS NAILS. ON EXAMINATION, WELL-DEMARCATED, SCALY PLAQUES WITH ASSOCIATED PUSTULES AND NAIL ATROPHY ARE PRESENT ON THE RIGHT SECOND AND THIRD DISTAL DIGITS. HE IS OTHERWISE HEALTHY.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a painful, recurring rash on my fingers with redness, irritation, and pustules around my nails, and my nails are also being destroyed.
Do you have any history of skin issues or allergies?
No, I don't have any history of skin issues or allergies.
Are you currently on any medications?
No, I am not on any medications.
Does anyone in your family have similar symptoms or any known skin conditions?
No, no one in my family has similar symptoms or any known skin conditions.
Do you frequently come in contact with water or irritants, such as cleaning agents or chemicals, during your daily activities?
No, I do not frequently come in contact with water or irritants like cleaning agents or chemicals during my daily activities.
Do you work in an occupation or have hobbies that require frequent or prolonged exposure to water or irritants?
No, my occupation and hobbies do not require frequent or prolonged exposure to water or irritants.
Have you noticed any pus or fluid draining from the affected areas around your nails?
Yes, I have noticed pustules around my nails.
Final Diagnosis: Acute Paronychia.
